title: Education for Optimizing Artistic Language Style Generation and Interaction in Virtual Reality Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic VR/AR concepts, experience in graphic design or programming, and foundational knowledge of linguistic expression and visual communication
context.additional_context: Experimental learning in BYOD environments, including case studies for language domain applications (visual narrative construction, multilingual interface design, etc.)

learning_goals: Acquire experimental design skills to analyze conflicts between graphic paradigms and natural language interactions in VR environments
Implement VR interface optimization and enhance visual expressiveness using aperture blur and component distance adjustment techniques

Within 6 months, learners develop a virtual environment generation framework with non-photorealistic rendering (NPR) techniques (cel shading, watercolor effects), implement ≥5 customizable parameters (color palettes, brush styles, text effects), and complete prototype demonstration/technical documentation
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
